body_html: I've solved this problem by using create_training_graph() right after the construction or building of the graph and right before running the session while training.And while freezing and deploying the graph for inference, I put create_eval_graph() right after the construction of the graph and right before converting variables in the graph to constants.Hope this can hope!
body_text: I've solved this problem by using create_training_graph() right after the construction or building of the graph and right before running the session while training.And while freezing and deploying the graph for inference, I put create_eval_graph() right  after the construction of the graph and right before converting variables in the graph to constants.Hope this can hope!
body: I've solved this problem by using create_training_graph() right after the construction or building of the graph and right before running the session while training.And while freezing and deploying the graph for inference, I put create_eval_graph() right  after the construction of the graph and right before converting variables in the graph to constants.Hope this can hope!
